Event.0: Chinese Premier Xi Jinping unveils his new ruling council in the Great Hall of the People, none of the five are young enough to succeed him
Event.1: Irish actor Richard Harris—who was notable not only for his formidable talent in portraying the intense, volatile, and rebellious hell-raising characters that established his image but also for conducting his real life in a similar manner—died in London.
Event.2:
Katy Perry
American singer
was born
Event.3: The U.S. military, under President Ronald Reagan, invaded the tiny island country of Grenada.
Event.4: "Halloween", directed by John Carpenter, starring Donald Pleasence and Jamie Lee Curtis in her film debut, is released
Event.5: United Nations votes to expel the Chinese Nationalist ruled Taiwan and admit the Communist People's Republic of China
Event.6: Dutchman Anton Geesink is 1st non-Japanese Olympic judo gold medal winner
Event.7: US Ambassador to the UN Adlai Stevenson demands USSR UN rep Zorin answer regarding Cuban missile bases saying "I am prepared to wait for my answer until hell freezes over"
Event.8: China entered the Korean War on the side of North Korea against South Korea and the United Nations (UN), the United States being the UN's principal participant.
Event.9: 1st trial against nazi war criminals in Nuremberg
Event.10: American collegiate basketball coach Bob Knight, whose 902 career NCAA coaching victories are among the most in men's basketball history, was born.
Event.11:
Bob Knight
American coach
was born
Event.12: Germany and Italy established the Rome-Berlin Axis.
Event.13:
Peter Naur
Danish astronomer and computer scientist
was born
Event.14:
Klaus Barbie
Nazi leader
was born
Event.15: The first performance of the Piano Concerto No. 1 by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky is given in Boston, Massachusetts with Hans von Bülow as soloist
Event.16: US President Chester A. Arthur (30) weds Ellen Herndon (22) at Calvary Episcopal Church in NYC, New York
Event.17: The infamous Charge of Light Brigade during the Battle of Balaclava in the Crimean War; over 100 killed
Event.18:
Johann Strauss II
Austrian composer
was born
Event.19: Governor of Virginia Patrick Henry (41) weds second wife Dorothea Dandridge
Event.20: Future 2nd American President John Adams (28) weds Abigail Smith (19) in Weymouth, Massachusetts (marriage lasts 54 years)
Event.21:
Cardinal Wolsey dismissed by Henry VIII
Henry VIII of England dismissed Thomas Cardinal Wolsey on this day in 1529 for his failure to legitimize Henry's affair with Anne Boleyn and one day later designated Sir Thomas More as lord chancellor in his place.
Event.22: The English, led by Henry V, scored a decisive victory over the French at the Battle of Agincourt in the Hundred Years' War.
Event.23: Battle of Agincourt: Henry V's forces defeat larger French army and the longbow defeats the armoured knight
